description: Irene Zhang reviews Yi Xiaohe's 'Salt Town,' a work of journalism exploring how rural Chinese women continue to face deep-rooted gender inequality despite decades of economic progress.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #106: Taiwan's LGBTQ History with Wen Liu
description: Wen Liu of Academia Sinica joins host Sophia Yan to trace the origins and evolution of Taiwan's LGBTQ movement, from the post-martial law era to its landmark legalization of same-sex marriage in 2019.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #107: Pearl Low on their platform, Cantonese Connection, and heritage language learning
description: Pearl Low discusses their platform Cantonese Connection, which offers inclusive Cantonese learning resources, and the challenges heritage language learners face in finding safe, supportive spaces to connect with their family's language.

title: NüVoices Podcast x Ghost Island Media Panel:  Covering Taiwan, Centering Local Perspectives, with Silva Shih, Afore Hsieh, Wen-Yee Lee, and Emily Y. Wu
description: A panel collaboration with Ghost Island Media exploring the importance of local and diverse perspectives in global coverage of Taiwan, featuring Taipei-based journalists Silva Shih, Afore Hsieh, and Wen-Yee Lee with host Emily Y. Wu.

title: NüProfile: Fiona Sze-Lorrain on creativity and her debut novel "Dear Chrysanthemums"
description: Fiona Sze-Lorrain discusses her debut novel "Dear Chrysanthemums," a collection of interconnected stories exploring the lives of Chinese and Asian women navigating trauma, identity, and exile across Shanghai, Paris, and beyond.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #108: #MeToo in Taiwan, a Conversation with Darice Chang and Rita Jhang
description: This episode explores the origins and impact of Taiwan's #MeToo movement with guests Darice Chang and Rita Jhang, discussing societal attitudes, feminism, and the intersection of #MeToo with Taiwan's upcoming election.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #109: 'How to Have an American Baby' with documentary filmmaker Leslie Tai
description: Host Solarina Ho speaks with filmmaker Leslie Tai about her documentary "How to Have an American Baby," which explores the shadow economy of birth tourism catering to Chinese tourists seeking U.S. citizenship for their newborns.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #110: Feminist Activism Then & Now, a Conversation with Wanqing Zhang, Lijia Zhang & Jessie Lau
description: NüVoices board members Jessie Lau and Lijia Zhang speak with journalist Wanqing Zhang about China's online feminist movement, exploring how activists navigate censorship and crackdowns through digital platforms like Xiaohongshu.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #111: A Conversation with Fuchsia Dunlop about her book, "Invitation to a Banquet"
description: Food writer Fuchsia Dunlop joins host Lijia Zhang to discuss her book "Invitation to a Banquet: The Story of Chinese Food," exploring Chinese culinary history, traditions, and culture.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #112: Leta Hong Fincher on the 10th Anniversary Edition of her book, Leftover Women
description: Leta Hong Fincher discusses the 10th anniversary edition of her book "Leftover Women," reflecting on its continued relevance, the origins of her research at Tsinghua University, and how pressures on unmarried women in China have evolved under Xi Jinping.

title: NüVoices Podcast Episode #113: Illustrator Kaitlin Chan on her graphic novel, 'Eric's Sister'
description: Illustrator Kaitlin Chan discusses her graphic novel 'Eric's Sister,' a slice-of-life story set in Hong Kong exploring sibling relationships, creative doubt, and the pressures facing first-generation college students pursuing careers in the arts.

title: NüVoices in Perugia: The rise and transformation of women's magazines and platforms
description: A panel at the International Journalism Festival in Perugia explored how young women's magazines and platforms have evolved from beauty-focused outlets into spaces for social activism and marginalized voices.

title: NüVoices Podcast #114: Indigenous culture, politics and activism in Taiwan, a Conversation with Tuhi Martukaw
description: Solarina Ho speaks with Indigenous policy advocate and journalist Tuhi Martukaw about Indigenous culture, politics, activism, and reconciliation in Taiwan, including her personal journey reconnecting with her roots.

title: NüVoices Podcast #115: UBC Students Podcast Special! Yi Chien Jade Ho on Anti-Gentrification Activism in Vancouver's Chinatown and Judith Shapiro on Environmentalism in China
description: Yi Chien Jade Ho discusses anti-gentrification activism and tenant organizing in Vancouver's Chinatown, and Judith Shapiro explores environmentalism in China, in a special collaboration with University of British Columbia students.

title: Book excerpt: Kate Whitehead's 'Pandemic Minds' explores mental health in Hong Kong
description: Kate Whitehead's 'Pandemic Minds' draws on 40 interviews to examine the mental health impact of Hong Kong's strict COVID-19 measures, offering stories of resilience and strategies for recovery.

title: NüVoices 2024 Global Updates / Wrap
description: A roundup of NüVoices' 2024 activities, covering podcast production, magazine publications, a journalism conference appearance, donation allocation transparency, and board elections.

title: Past, present and poetry: Hong Kong filmmaker Ann Hui’s 'July Rhapsody'
description: A look at Ann Hui's contemplative Hong Kong drama July Rhapsody, in which a middle-aged Chinese literature teacher grapples with past regrets, present desires, and a midlife crossroads.

title: Fiction: A Long Walk Through the Tall Dry Grass
description: A twelve-year-old girl in rural Guangdong tends her family's farm as the Japanese army advances during the Second Sino-Japanese War, her life changed by her mother's heartbreaking decision. Inspired by the author's grandmother's early life.

title: NüProfile: Jih-E Peng on cinematography and the creative process
description: Taiwanese cinematographer Jih-E Peng, based in New York, discusses her creative process, career spanning documentaries to narrative films, and her latest project Girls Will Be Girls.

title: LONDON PANEL: Navigating Feminist Organising in ESEA communities
description: A London panel event exploring feminist organising, racism, and solidarity-building within East and Southeast Asian communities, hosted by Moongate Productions and moderated by NüVoices editor Jessie Lau.

title: NüVoices Podcast #116: Model Minority Gone Rogue, a Conversation with Qin Qin
description: Host Chenni Xu speaks with author Qin Qin about her memoir "Model Minority Gone Rogue," exploring her journey from overachieving ex-lawyer to living on her own terms, plus book recommendations and self-care tips.

title: Memoir excerpt: Model Minority Gone Rogue by Qin Qin
description: An excerpt from Qin Qin's memoir Model Minority Gone Rogue, exploring the ever-rising expectations she faced as the daughter of a tiger mother and her journey to break free from them.

title: Encore: Chinese Canadian Immigrant Histories with Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng
description: Historians Arlene Chan and Melanie Ng discuss Chinese Canadian migration from 19th-century arrivals through anti-Chinese immigration laws, with firsthand accounts from immigrant Sheila Wiecke.

title: EVENT: NüVoices Virtual Workshop Series |  Freelance Writing and Pitching with Suyin Haynes and Jessie Lau
description: A NüVoices virtual workshop on freelance writing and pitching led by journalists Suyin Haynes and Jessie Lau, covering how to craft standout pitches for print and digital outlets.

title: 2025 NüStories Essay Contest
description: NüStories held its first annual personal essay contest on the theme of Chinese identity, inviting creative nonfiction by underrepresented writers, and awarded cash prizes to top entries exploring diverse experiences of Chinese-ness.

title: Reflections on a light show
description: Two writers compose independent reflections on their shared experience of James Turrell's Gathered Sky light installation in 2017 Beijing, inspired by Annie Ernaux's The Use of Photography.

title: NüVoices Podcast #117: A Career in Foreign Correspondence and Podcasting, a Conversation with Jane Perlez
description: Hosts Chenni Xu and Megan Cattel speak with Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Jane Perlez about her decades-long foreign correspondence career, her time as NYT Beijing bureau chief, and her pivot to podcasting with "Face-Off: the US versus China."

title: NüVoices Podcast #118: Scam Inc. from The Economist, a Conversation with Sue-Lin Wong
description: NüVoices co-hosts Chenni Xu and Megan Cattel talk with The Economist's Sue-Lin Wong about her investigative podcast series Scam Inc., exploring the global scam industry, its links to human trafficking and corruption, and how scamming has evolved into a gig-economy model.

title: EVENT: NüVoices Virtual Workshop Series | Transforming Memory into Story with Karen Cheung
description: A virtual workshop led by Hong Kong writer Karen Cheung on transforming personal archives—diaries, photos, and chat logs—into nonfiction writing, exploring forms like the fragmented essay and prose poem. Held via Zoom with interactive exercises and Q&A.

title: NüVoices Podcast #119: Let Only Red Flowers Bloom, a Conversation with Emily Feng
description: NüVoices co-founder Joanna Chiu speaks with NPR correspondent Emily Feng about her book "Let Only Red Flowers Bloom," exploring identity, state oppression, and belonging in Xi Jinping's China.

title: Meet Our New Podcast Production Team
description: NüVoices introduces new podcast team members Rebecca Liu and Wing Kuang, who joined as editor/sound designer and producer respectively, stepping in as the organization continues to develop emerging journalism talent.

title: Podcast Crossover: Feminist Rebels from Face-Off: the U.S. vs China with Jane Perlez
description: A crossover episode from Jane Perlez's Face-Off: The U.S. vs China podcast explores the feminist movement in Greater China, featuring Leta Hong Fincher on gender inequality and women pushing back against restrictive social norms.

title: Chinese women use hashtags like "baby food" to shield from sexist men, but remain vulnerable to abuse
description: As Chinese social media platforms like Xiaohongshu attract more male users, women resort to coded hashtags to avoid harassment, highlighting persistent gaps in platform safety and privacy protections.

title: NüVoices Podcast #120: How I Stopped Being a Model Minority with Anne Anlin Cheng
description: Stephanie Tam speaks with Anne Anlin Cheng about her book "Ordinary Disasters," exploring the model minority myth, finding a personal voice in writing, and navigating race, grief, and interracial intimacy as an Asian American woman.

title: Memoir excerpt: Chinese Parents Don't Say I Love You
description: An excerpt from Candice Chung's memoir explores how two young sisters in Sydney learned to fend for themselves with Spam recipes while their mother struggled with unspoken depression.

title: "You need glasses for Asian faces."
description: Winner of the NüStories personal essay contest, this piece explores Chinese identity and self-perception through the author's search for glasses designed to fit Asian faces.

title: What You Know (And Didn't Know)
description: A personal essay exploring childhood memories of a grandmother's funeral, reflecting on grief, loss, and the limits of understanding death at age seven. Third-prize winner in the NüStories personal essay contest on Chinese identity.

title: Chinese Female Stand-Up Comedians and their Prisoner's Dilemma
description: Chinese female stand-up comedians navigate intense backlash and audience hostility as they push boundaries on gender and taboo topics in a comedy scene shaped by Yang Li's polarizing 2020 controversy.

title: In queer diaspora, my fear leaks through
description: Anran Zheng reflects on dreams of returning home and navigating queer identity in the Chinese diaspora in Canada. A runner-up in the NüStories personal essay contest on Chinese identity.

title: Mother Tongue
description: Kim Gordon reflects on mixed-race Chinese identity, tracing her family's Malaysian-Chinese diaspora history and the complexities of belonging as a child of both East and West.

title: A trip to the supermarket
description: A runner-up in NüStories' personal essay contest, this piece explores the author's experience navigating Chinese-Canadian identity, from forgetting how to write their Chinese name to reconciling cultural expectations.

title: I am a Midwestern Chinese Girl
description: Jenna Wang reflects on growing up Chinese in Iowa, tracing her family's journey from China to the American Midwest and navigating cultural identity in one of the least diverse U.S. states.

title: I work in US policy – being Chinese is now an occupational hazard
description: A half-Chinese US policy analyst reflects on how rising suspicion toward people of Chinese heritage in national security circles has turned her ethnic background into a professional liability.

title: 'Beauty Queen': Excerpt from Anne Anlin Cheng's Memoir 'Ordinary Disasters'
description: An excerpt from Anne Anlin Cheng's memoir "Ordinary Disasters: How I Stopped Being a Model Minority," exploring beauty standards, family legacy, and growing up among celebrated beauties in Tainan, Taiwan.

title: NüProfile: Amy Ng on playwriting and her show 'Shanghai Dolls' - a feminist retelling of famous female figures in the Cultural Revolution
description: Amy Ng discusses her play "Shanghai Dolls," which dramatizes the probable friendship between Jiang Qing (Madame Mao) and Sun Weishi, two influential women whose lives intersected from 1930s Shanghai to the Cultural Revolution.

title: NüVoices Podcast #121: Wenchi Yu, a Career in Diplomacy, Influence and Impact
description: Wenchi Yu discusses her career spanning the US Congress, State Department, Goldman Sachs, and nonprofits, and shares her perspective on US-China-Taiwan relations and working as a bridge-builder across diplomacy and media.

title: Book Excerpt: 'Chinese And Any Other Asian' by Anna Sulan Masing
description: An excerpt from Anna Sulan Masing's "Chinese And Any Other Asian" exploring how race and gender intersected during her formative years, shaping her sense of identity and place in the world.

title: Beijing International Film Festival brings Chinese films to a UK audience
description: The 15th Beijing International Film Festival hosted a special London screening of Tiantian Award-winning Chinese films, aiming to bring Chinese cinema to global audiences. Here are reviews of the featured selections.

title: Exhibition: Ways of Remembering Hong Kong
description: The Hong Kong Action Archives presented "Ways of Remembering" at London's Hoxton Arches, featuring archival artifacts and oral histories documenting Hong Kong's social movements since 2019, alongside community workshops and performances.

title: Essay by a Manchu girl in Tibet: Finding My Chinese Identity
description: A Manchu university student from Heilongjiang reflects on growing up as an ethnic minority in China, recounting experiences of discrimination and questioning what it means to be Chinese beyond the official narrative of national unity.

title: Book Excerpt: 'I Am Not a Tourist' by Daisy J. Hung
description: An excerpt from Daisy J. Hung's "I Am Not a Tourist" explores the overlooked histories of Chinese women in Britain, from early migrants and performers to community figures like Emily Hoare.

title: NüVoices Podcast #122: Sonalie Figueiras, Demystifying Eco-Living and Sustainability Myths
description: NüVoices host Tiffany Ap talks with Green Queen founder Sonalie Figueiras about practical eco-living tips, Asia's role in climate and food tech innovation, and whether cultural attitudes toward overconsumption are shifting.

title: NüVoices Podcast #Special: Amanda Hsiao, on Trump 2.0 and Beijing’s new tactics
description: Amanda Hsiao of Eurasia Group discusses Trump 2.0's approach to China and Beijing's response, covering trade tariffs, new tactics from both sides, and the evolving US-China relationship with host Sophia Yan.

title: Homecoming at the Cemetery
description: Tara Sun Vanacore visits her great-grandparents' cemetery outside Taipei after her mother's death, retracing family origins and reflecting on grief and Chinese identity.

title: Living in London, Belonging Nowhere
description: A runner-up in NüStories' first personal essay contest on Chinese identity, this piece reflects on life in London while grappling with distance from China during the COVID-19 pandemic.
